data.question: What is the chemical formula of the chromium(II)-based metal–organic framework discussed?
data.answer: Cr3[(Cr4Cl)3(BTT)8]2

data.question: What are the potential applications of the Cr-BTT framework?
data.answer: H2 storage and O2 production

data.question: What is the selectivity factor of Cr-BTT for O2 over N2 at compositions relevant to air purification?
data.answer: In excess of 2500

data.question: What method was used to synthesize the Cr-BTT framework?
data.answer: Air-free reaction of anhydrous CrCl2, Cr(CO)6, H3BTT, and trifluoromethanesulfonic acid in dimethylformamide (DMF)

data.question: What is the BET surface area of the activated Cr-BTT framework?
What is the reversible O2 capacity of Cr-BTT at 298 K after 15 adsorption cycles?
data.answer: At least 4.6 wt %

data.question: Why does Cr-BTT have excellent O2/N2 selectivity?
data.answer: Due to selective electron transfer to form CrIII superoxide moieties

data.question: How does the Cr-BTT framework achieve selective, reversible O2 adsorption?
data.answer: Through an electron-transfer mechanism that forms end-on superoxide species

data.question: Why is the Cr-BTT framework considered promising for gas separations?
data.answer: Because of its extraordinarily high capacities and adsorption selectivities for gases

data.question: What makes Cr-BTT different from other M-BTT frameworks in terms of gas adsorption?
data.answer: Its strongly reducing nature of chromium(II) which endows it with excellent O2/N2 selectivity

data.question: How was the activated Cr-BTT framework prepared?
data.answer: By desolvation through soaking in fresh DMF, followed by methanol exchange and heating overnight at 150 88C under a dynamic vacuum

data.question: What is the role of coordinatively unsaturated metal sites in metal–organic frameworks?
data.answer: They exhibit high capacities and adsorption selectivities for various gas separations

data.question: Is the Cr-BTT framework synthesized using a high-pressure method?
data.answer: False, it is synthesized using an air-free reaction, not a high-pressure method

data.question: Does Cr-BTT have a BET surface area greater than 3000 m2 g-1?
data.answer: False, its BET surface area is 2030 m2 g-1

data.question: Can Cr-BTT bind O2 molecules in a side-on fashion?
data.answer: False, O2 molecules bind in an end-on fashion

data.question: Is Cr-BTT's O2 adsorption capacity unaffected by adsorption/desorption cycles?
data.answer: False, there is a moderate loss in capacity after the first cycle

data.question: Does Cr-BTT exhibit the highest stable cycling capacity for O2 under mild conditions?
data.answer: True, it represents the highest stable cycling capacity for any porous material under mild conditions

data.question: Is the Cr-BTT framework only suitable for hydrogen storage applications?
data.answer: False, it is investigated for both H2 storage and O2 production

data.question: Does Cr-BTT lose reversibility above 220 K?
data.answer: False, that statement applies to Fe2(dobdc), not Cr-BTT

data.question: Is the synthesis of Cr-BTT conducted in an oxygen-rich environment?
data.answer: False, it is conducted in an air-free environment
